page.title: 20LANDSCAPE
page.content: THE LANDSCAPE OF OUR BLOCK CAN BE DESCRIBED AS GENTLY ROLLING HILLSIDE THAT IS PARTIALLY WOODED. ALTHOUGH THERE ARE NOT ANY REALLY HIGH HILLS, MOST OF THE ROADS AND PATHS IN OUR BLOCK INVOLVE SOME INCLINES. WHEN WE LOOKED AT SOME AERIAL PICTURES OF OUR AREA WE COULD SEE CLEARLY THAT HOUSING DEVELOPMEMT HAD, GENERALLY, NOT MADE MUCH IMPACT ON THE OVERALL LANDSCAPE WHICH WAS CLEARLY STILL VERY MUCH DOMINATED BY FARMING. THE PICTURE HAD BEEN TAKEN IN THE SUMMER TWO OR THREE YEARS AGO, AND SHOWED THAT MUCH OF OUR AREA WAS UNDER CULTIVATION USUALLY WITH GRAIN CROPS. THIS YEAR IT WAS CLEAR THAT THERE WERE MORE MEADOWS BEING USED FOR GRAZING BUT THERE WERE STILL SEVERAL LARGE AREAS BEING USED FOR VARIOUS TYPES OF CROPS.
